titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2010 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on January 12, 2010

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Connecticut Siting Council records
did.abstract: The Connecticut Siting Council has jurisdiction over the siting of power facilities, transmission lines, hazardous waste facilities and various other forms of infrastructure including telecommunications sites.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Connecticut Siting Council was first established as the Power Facility Evaluation Council in 1972 following the passage of the Public Utility Environmental Standards Act. In 1981, it became known as the Connecticut Siting Council with the passage of PA 81-369, which expanded the Council’s original jurisdiction over the siting of power facilities and transmission lines to include hazardous waste facilities. The Council’s jurisdiction has since been extended to include various other forms of infrastructure including telecommunications sites.
Source: Connecticut Siting Council website, "About Us" page at http://www.ct.gov/csc/cwp/view.asp?a=895&q=248310 (viewed January 13, 2010).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: There is currently only one series of hearing transcripts, 1973-1992.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1. Hearing transcripts, 1973-1992, are arranged by docket number.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
RG 041:002, Public Utilities Commission, 1911-1988, bulk 1911-1976
RG 041:004, Public Utlities Control Authority, 1975-1976

controlaccess.subject: Administrative agencies -- Public meetings -- Connecticut

Cellular telephone systems -- Environmental aspects -- Connecticut
Radio and television towers -- Environmental aspects -- Connecticut

Mobile communication systems -- Environmental aspects -- Connecticut
Power-plants -- Environmental aspects -- Connecticut
Hydroelectric power plants -- Environmental aspects -- Connecticut

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

did.unittitle: Series 1. Hearing Transcripts

Docket No. 1B, Application on behalf of the Connecticut Light and Power Company for a second amendment to the certificate of environmental compatibility and public need issued to the Northeast Utilities Service Company on January 31, 1973 in connection with its proposed 115 kV electric transmission line between Branford and Old Saybrook, Connecticut

note.p: There are two transcripts for April 2, 1975 because there were two sessions that day.
There are two copies of the May 12, 1975 transcript.
